content: Which famous British scientist and author of 'A Brief History of Time' spent most of his life in a wheelchair due to a motor neuron disease?

The famous British scientist you're referring to is Stephen Hawking. He was a theoretical physicist, cosmologist, and author who wrote "A Brief History of Time." Hawking spent most of his life in a wheelchair due to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), a motor neuron disease. Despite his physical challenges, he made significant contributions to the fields of cosmology and theoretical physics, particularly in the study of black holes and the origins of the universe.
